feed.title: Trend Science and Research
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Structural Insights: Exploring the Impact of Deep Foundation Pit Excavation on Rail Transit Structures
entry.summary:
In the world today, various research studies and advancements have been made in different fields. In the field of construction and infrastructure, a numerical simulation study has been conducted to analyze the impact of deep foundation pit excavation on adjacent rail transit structures. This case study aims to understand the potential effects and develop strategies to mitigate any negative consequences.

In the medical field, several studies have been conducted to improve healthcare and address specific issues. One such study focuses on foreign bodies in pediatric otorhinolaryngology, providing a comprehensive review of the subject. This research aims to enhance understanding and treatment options for children with foreign objects in their ears, nose, or throat.

Another study explores the sleep, mood, and nutrition patterns of postmenopausal women diagnosed with major depressive disorder during different menopause periods. This research sheds light on the relationship between menopause and mental health, potentially leading to improved treatment approaches.

In the realm of healthcare, a cross-cultural adaptation and validation of an attitude about euthanasia scale has been conducted among Portuguese older adults with mixed anxiety-depressive disorder. This study aims to understand cultural perspectives on euthanasia and its implications for healthcare decision-making.

In the field of oncology, a systematic review has been conducted to analyze the topographic patterns of intracranial meningioma recurrences. This research provides valuable insights for clinicians and researchers in managing and treating this type of brain tumor.

Advancements in materials science are also being made, with a focus on lubricating polymer gels/coatings. Synthesis and measurement strategies are being developed to enhance the performance and durability of these materials, potentially benefiting various industries.

In the sports domain, insights have been gained from a sport-based living lab, emphasizing the importance of real-world testing and observations. This approach allows for a better understanding of the practical implications of sports-related interventions and innovations.

In the field of diagnostics, a study has explored the use of microparticles in human perspiration as an inflammatory response index. This research could lead to the development of non-invasive diagnostic tools for assessing inflammation and related conditions.

Additionally, a study has assessed the visual acuity of a large group of four-year-olds, providing standardized assessment and defining normative visual acuity thresholds. This research contributes to the understanding of visual development in young children and aids in early detection of visual impairments.

Lastly, a study has evaluated the efficacy of a formalin-inactivated vaccine against Red Seabream Iridovirus (RSIV) in laboratory and field conditions. This research aims to improve vaccine development and disease prevention strategies in aquaculture.

In terms of new tools, products, or projects, there are several notable advancements. One such development is the use of lubricating polymer gels/coatings, which have the potential to enhance the performance and durability of various products and machinery. Additionally, the study on microparticles in human perspiration as an inflammatory response index could lead to the development of innovative diagnostic tools for assessing inflammation and related conditions. Furthermore, the sport-based living lab approach provides a new way to gain insights and test interventions in the field of sports. These advancements and projects demonstrate the continuous efforts to improve various aspects of our lives and enhance our understanding of the world around us.
